channel.title: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?
channel.description:
Okay, I guess this mostly goes out to the staff, because they have the actual say in this. But I've noticed there isn't much rules to the signatures (I mean, besides the porn rule, and the images).
Like, what links am I allowed to post, what aren't I allowed to? Could I, for-say, bash on another Mopar user simply because I don't like them? Could I express blatant racism? Could I post a link to something I had created, [b]as long as it is proven virus-free[/b] [I say that because I had a link to a "Gold generator" that I was asked to remove because people thought I was actually taking passwords, when really, the password field didn't even work properly] and so on?
I guess it's easier to ask, what isn't allowed? [Thus why I had (n't) in the title]

item.title: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:25, topic:523713”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=642258.msg4325444#msg4325444 date=1372823379]

You can have links in your signature, if anything wouldn’t be allowed I doubt they will allow malware links or ad links to sites that make you do surveys for downloads, I doubt they allow you to link to content that isn’t for the youth.

I got in trouble for this link even though I proved it wasn’t malicious of any sort.
[/quote]

imho that shouldn’t be allowed. We could approve it, and a week later you could change it to record passwords without us knowing. It would be pretty embarrassing if we approved a phishing site.

Also keep in mind we don’t have direct rules for every scenario. Its our own discretion and theres no loop holes to be found.[/quote]not having all bases covered is having loop holes?

Read full topic
item.source: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?

I got in trouble for this link even though I proved it wasn’t malicious of any sort.
[/quote]

imho that shouldn’t be allowed. We could approve it, and a week later you could change it to record passwords without us knowing. It would be pretty embarrassing if we approved a phishing site.

Also keep in mind we don’t have direct rules for every scenario. Its our own discretion and theres no loop holes to be found.[/quote]
Scamming on RS is so scrub. Like if you can’t scam a kid on rs. I can’t even make that comparison.
Anyways.
I’d like some general clarification.

Read full topic

item.title: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach

@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I quoted an infraction then said “,fuck off” immediately after quoting it and I got a like +40 infraction once. So I’m guessing that isn’t allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:523713”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=642258.msg4325439#msg4325439 date=1372822979]
You can have links in your signature, if anything wouldn’t be allowed I doubt they will allow malware links or ad links to sites that make you do surveys for downloads, I doubt they allow you to link to content that isn’t for the youth.
[/quote]
I got in trouble for this link even though I proved it wasn’t malicious of any sort.[/quote]

imho that shouldn’t be allowed. We could approve it, and a week later you could change it to record passwords without us knowing. It would be pretty embarrassing if we approved a phishing site.

Also keep in mind we don’t have direct rules for every scenario. Its our own discretion and theres no loop holes to be found.

Read full topic

item.title: What is(n't) allowed to be in our signatures?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:22, topic:523713”][quote author=Travas link=topic=642258.msg4325469#msg4325469 date=1372825771]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=642258.msg4325466#msg4325466 date=1372824844]

Just ask a moderator about links you are not sure about before putting them in your signature.

I did, actually. I talked to Ruby before I did. And ~1 week later he told me to remove it.
[/quote]What did Ruby say when you talked to him?

It’s always better to ask a more experienced mod with these kind of questions.
[/quote]implying Ruby doesn’t have moderator experience. :rolleyes:[/quote]Compared to everyone else, he doesn’t.

Read full topic

If you don’t believe me, use it and don’t put in a password. I could show you the source code + the directory it’s in. There’s nothing to save the password
